title: Two Sum
summary: Use a hash map to store complements while scanning the array once.
key_steps: Iterate through the array while storing needed complements in a dictionary.
Check if the current value already exists as a complement.
Return indices when a complement pair is found.

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
summary: Track the minimum price so far and compute the best profit in one pass.
key_steps: Maintain the smallest price encountered so far.
Calculate profit by subtracting the minimum from the current price.
Update the best profit accordingly.

title: Valid Anagram
summary: Count character frequencies and compare to determine if two strings are anagrams.
key_steps: Count characters of the first string using a dictionary or array.
Decrement counts using the second string.
Ensure all counts return to zero.

title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
summary: Use two pointers to merge two sorted linked lists into one sorted list.
key_steps: Initialize a dummy head and a tail pointer.
Advance the pointer pointing to the smaller current node.
Attach remaining nodes when one list is exhausted.

title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
summary: Traverse the binary tree level by level using a queue.
key_steps: Add the root to a queue and iterate while the queue is not empty.
Process all nodes in the current level before moving to the next level.
Collect node values per level for the result.

title: Number of Islands
summary: Count connected components in a grid by exploring each unvisited land cell.
key_steps: Iterate through the grid and start a search whenever you see unvisited land.
Use DFS or BFS to mark all connected land as visited.
Increment the island count for each completed traversal.

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
summary: Use a sliding window to expand and shrink the substring while tracking character positions.
key_steps: Maintain a window with unique characters using a hash map for indices.
Shrink the window when a duplicate is encountered.
Update the maximum length at each step.

title: 3Sum
summary: Sort the array and use a two-pointer approach to find triplets that sum to zero.
key_steps: Sort the array and fix one index.
Use two pointers to scan for complement pairs.
Skip duplicates to avoid repeated triplets.

title: Course Schedule
summary: Detect cycles in a directed graph to determine if all courses can be finished.
key_steps: Represent prerequisites as a directed graph.
Perform DFS with states to detect cycles or use Kahn's algorithm.
Return true if no cycles are found.

title: Word Break
summary: Use dynamic programming to determine if the string can be segmented into dictionary words.
key_steps: Initialize a boolean DP array where dp[i] indicates the prefix up to i is segmentable.
Iterate over the string and check dictionary words that end at the current index.
Return the value of the last DP entry.

title: Climbing Stairs
summary: Compute the nth Fibonacci number to determine distinct ways to climb stairs.
key_steps: Recognize the recurrence f(n) = f(n-1) + f(n-2).
Iterate from the base cases up to n while storing the last two values.
Return the nth value.

title: LRU Cache
summary: Combine a hash map with a doubly linked list to achieve O(1) get and put operations.
key_steps: Use a hash map to map keys to nodes in the linked list.
Move nodes to the front on access and remove from the tail when capacity is exceeded.
Update pointers carefully to maintain the structure.

title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
summary: Use binary search on the smaller array to find a partition where left halves are less than right halves.
key_steps: Ensure the first array is the smaller one for binary searching.
Use binary search to partition the arrays into balanced halves.
Compute the median based on the partition boundaries.

title: Regular Expression Matching
summary: Use dynamic programming to handle '.' and '*' wildcard matching rules.
key_steps: Define dp[i][j] as whether s[i:] matches p[j:].
Handle '.' by matching any single character and '*' by zero or more occurrences.
Fill the DP table bottom-up or top-down with memoization.

title: Alien Dictionary
summary: Construct ordering constraints from sorted words and perform a topological sort.
key_steps: Compare adjacent words to deduce ordering edges.
Build an adjacency list and in-degree counts.
Run Kahn's algorithm and detect cycles if result length mismatches.
